column4: from what I've read, upstart should still read inittab if it's there but doesn't seem to, and I've tried creating an events.d file for it and it's not starting through that either
I can force it to start.... but it's not starting on runlevel
can you pastebin your event.d file?
can you paste your sshtunnel script (with hosts change if you want)
and I'm assuming the script blocks and doesn't exit?
I would change the start lines to "start on stopped rc2" etc, and see if the problem is network and ssh not being up yet
how does that work? I'm in runlevel2 now...
run "initctl list" you'll see that rc2 is stoped
the "rc2" upstart job is stopped technically
you can stop and start rc2 but I have no idea how that works, since the main problem you're having is ONLY on reboot I would suggest you have to test it that way :-(
but I would assume the probably is a race condition since the default thing just runs rc2 AND your job at the same time right away
you could maybe sleep until you can ping the host in your script as another possible solution (if that's the problem)
looks good to me, even if it's wrong you'll just end up with the job not started (visisble in sudo initctl list)
